Gubsu Lepas Atlet Peparpenas, Popnas, dan Pospenas 2019
05 Nov 2019, 19:46 by Dadan SF


Gubsu Lepas Atlet Peparpenas, Popnas, dan Pospenas 2019

KBRN, Medan: Gubernur Sumatera Utara (Gubsu), Edy Rahmayadi mengukuhkan sekaligus melepas kontingen Sumatera Utara yang akan berlaga di tiga event olahraga nasional untuk tingkat pelajar. Penglepasan berlangsung di Aula Raja Inal Siregar, lantai II kantor Gubsu, Selasa (5/11/2019) sore.
Para atlet Sumut akan berlaga di tiga event olahraga nasional berbeda, yakni Pekan Paralympic Pelajar Nasional (Peparpenas), Pekan Olahraga Pelajar Nasional (Popnas), dan Pekan Olahraga dan Seni antar Pondok Pesantren Nasional (Pospenas). Total Sumut diperkuat 191 atlet. Pada ajang Peparpenas  tahun ini Sumut diperkuat 20 atlet, sementara di Popnas Sumut berkekuatan 81 atlet 31 pelatih dan 11 official. dan di ajang Pospenas kontingen Sumut diperkuat 90 atlet santri.
Usai tiba di Aula, Edy kemudian memberikan motivasi kepada seluruh atlet serta pelatih. Edy berharap kepada seluruh atlet yang berlaga di ketiga event tersebut bisa nantinya membawa nama harum Sumut di ajang nasional. Edy berpesan kiranya keterbatasan fisik yang dialami atlet NPC bukan menjadi penghalang untuk meraih prestasi. Terlebih bagi atlet Popnas kiranya bisa meraih prestasi lebih baik dari atlet difabel yang meski dengan keterbatasan, bisa meraih prestasi.
“Keterbatasan yang dimiliki atlet disabilitas bukan penghalang untuk meraih prestasi. Tanamkan semangat juang kalian, tunjukkan bahwa meskipun memiliki keterbatasan, kalian mampu berprestasi. Begitu juga atlet pelajar yang dalam kondisi fisik normal, contoh mereka ini (difabel). Semangat untuk berjuang demi membawa nama harum Sumut harus ditanamkan dalam diri kita. Buat Sumut bangga di tingkat nasional,” pinta Edy.
Terkhusus kepada para atlet santri dari sejumlah pondok pesantren di Sumut, kiranya bisa menunjukkan prestasi terbaik di bidang olahraga dan seni. Edy berpesan, latihan keras selama ini juga harus diseimbangkan dengan moral dan ibadah yang baik kepada Tuhan. Menurut Edy, segala usaha akan berhasil, jika dibarengi dengan doa dan keimanan pada diri masing – masing.
“Kepada para santri – santri dari seluruh pondok pesantren yang akan berlaga di Pospenas nanti, raihlah prestasi terbaik,” pesan Gubsu.
JUARA UMUM
Pada ketiga event olahraga ini, tidak tanggung - tanggung, Edy berharap Sumut bisa mendominasi di semua cabang. "Harus mendominasi seluruh cabang, membesarkan nama Sumut yang kita cintai ini," ujarnya.
Edy menargetkan Sumut harus bisa meraih juara umum di tiga event nasional tingkat pelajar. Jika hal itu tidak tercapai, maka dijadikan evaluasi untuk bisa dicapai di tahun selanjutnya. "Targetnya mendominasi. Kita harus juara umum. Kalau tidak dapat sekarang ini, itu sebagai bahan pelajaran sekarang. Kita kejar di tahun depan harus dapat. Tapi, tahun ini maksimal untuk berbuat," jelas Edy. 
Gubsu berharap para atlet untuk tidak menyerah dalam kondisi apapun demi meraih prestasi terbaik. "Kelen diberangkatkan untuk bertarung dalam kondisi apapun. Tidak ada alasan apapun kalian untuk tidak juara. Apapun kondisimu, kami harus berprestasi," pesan Edy. 
Edy mengaku, para atlet pelajar saat ini merupakan cikal bakal atlet senior yang akan berlaga di event nasional seperti Pekan Olahraga Nasional (PON) 2024, saat Sumut dan Aceh menjadi tuan rumah bersama. Edy juga berpesan kepada seluruh atlet untuk mengerahkan kemampuan maksimal demi nama baik diri sendiri, keluarga, dan negara.
"Buat besar nama dirimu, keluarga, provinsi dan bangsamu. Tidak ada cita - cita lain. Kalian sudah berani menjadi atlet. Jangan pernah kalian menyerah, bila perlu kamu pingsan di finish. Sumut itu gak hebat, kalo gak ada anak yang berprestasi. Menangkan itu kamu bertanding. Tolong saya minta talent scouting ke depan. Kalian banggakan Sumut ini 2024 PON di sini," pinta Gubsu.
Sementara ketua kontingen Sumut Baharuddin Siagian mengatakan pada ketiga event ini total kontingen Sumut berjumlah 280 atlet, pelatih, dan official.
"Jumlah kontingen Peparpenas 33 orang berasal dari lima cabor. Popnas 126 orang terdiri 11 cabor. Kontingen Pospenas 121 orang dari berbagai pesantren se Sumut," ucap Baharuddin.  
Baharuddin berharap dengan pemberangkatan dan motivasi yang diberikan Gubsu, bisa menambah semangat juang pelajar dan santri sebelum berlaga. "Mudah - mudahan pemberangkatan ini bisa menjadi motivasi dan menjadikan Sumut bermartabat di bidang olahraga," harap Baharuddin. 

20 Atlet Peparpenas

Pada Peparpenas tahun ini, kontingen Sumut bakal diperkuat 20 atlet yang berasal dari lima cabang olahraga yang terbagi dalam empat jenis klasifikasi. Klasifikasi Tuna netra dipilih empat atlet yakni Muhammad Triresha Anjasta, Fransiskus Zebua (atletik), Khairunnnisa dan Yayukari Mendrofa (catur). Kemudian 8 atlet tuna Daksa M Auliya Anshori (renang), Muhammad Rizky, Prayuda, Desy Manik, Robby Syahrul Ramadhan, Geryn Pratama Simatupang, Reza Aulia (atletik). Serta Zay Fachri (Boccia). Kemudian tuna Grahita M Khairurrasyid (bulutangkis), Yuwanda, Timotius Cen Agung, Agnes Monica (atletik). Serta Tuna Rungu Wicara Riyadh Firmansyah, Madinsama Arinta Pinem, dan Lidya Meisyarah (atletik), dan Janesa Liliana (renang).
Baharuddin Siagian mengatakan, selekda dilakukan secara terbuka dengan merekrut atlet difabel dari sejumlah Yayasan Sekolah Luar Biasa dan umum di Sumut. Dengan selekda ini tentu untuk mendapatkan atlet terbaik, untuk perkuat Sumut di Peparpenas 2019. “Ya inilah salah satu rangkaian yang kita lakukan supaya merekrut atlet itu tidak suka – suka. Harus kita lihat dari semua aspek, aspek kemampuan atlet serta teknik- teknik yang didapatkannya gitu. Jadi, tidak asal comot – comot saja,” ucap pria yang juga Kepala Dinas Pemuda dan Olahraga (Kadispora) Sumut ini.
Sebelumnya para atlet Sumut akan mengawali laga di ajang Peparpenas ke - IX yang dimulai 6-13 November, di Jakarta. Kemudian berlanjut di Popnas ke - XV mulai 16-25 November di Jakarta. Serta Pospenas Ke - VIII mulai 24 – 30 November di Bandung, Jawa Barat. 
Turut hadir dalam penglepasan atlet anggota DPRD Sumut Yulizar Pargalutan, Kakanwil Menteri Agama Provsu, Iwan Zulhami, Forkopimdasu, NPC Sumut, KONI Sumut, dan pengprov cabor. (J)

Governor of North Sumatra Remove Athletes Peparpenas, Popnas, and Pospenas 2019
05 Nov 2019, 19:46 by Dadan SF


Governor of North Sumatra Remove Athletes Peparpenas, Popnas, and Pospenas 2019

KBRN, Medan: Governor of North Sumatra (Gubsu), Edy Rahmayadi, confirmed and released the North Sumatra contingent who will compete in three national sporting events at the student level. The release took place in the Hall of Raja Inal Siregar, second floor of the North Sumatra Governor's Office, Tuesday (11/05/2019) afternoon.
The North Sumatra athletes will compete in three different national sporting events, namely the National Student Paralympic Week (Peparpenas), the National Student Sports Week (Popnas), and the Sports and Arts Week between the National Islamic Boarding Schools (Pospenas). Total North Sumatra strengthened 191 athletes. In this year's Peparpenas event, North Sumatra was strengthened by 20 athletes, while in Popnas North Sumatra there were 81 athletes with 31 trainers and 11 officials. and in North Sumatra the Pospenas contingent was strengthened by 90 santri athletes.
After arriving in the Hall, Edy then gave motivation to all athletes and coaches. Edy hopes that all athletes competing in the three events can later carry the fragrant name of North Sumatra at the national event. Edy advised that the physical limitations experienced by NPC athletes were not a barrier to achievement. Especially for Popnas athletes it is possible to achieve better achievements than disabled athletes who, despite their limitations, can achieve.
"The limitations of disability athletes are not a barrier to achievement. Instill your fighting spirit, show that despite your limitations, you are able to excel. Likewise, student athletes who are in normal physical condition, their example is (disabled). The spirit to fight for the sake of carrying the fragrant name of North Sumatra must be instilled in us. Make North Sumatra proud at the national level, "pleaded Edy.
Especially to the santri athletes from a number of Islamic boarding schools in North Sumatra, presumably they can show the best achievements in sports and arts. Edy advised, hard training so far must also be balanced with morals and good worship of God. According to Edy, all efforts will succeed, if coupled with prayer and faith in each other.
"To the students from all Islamic boarding schools who will compete at the Pospenas later, get the best achievement," the Governor of North Sumatra ordered.
GENERAL CHAMPION
In these three sporting events, Edy hopes that North Sumatra can dominate in all branches. "Must dominate the entire branch, raising the name of North Sumatra, which we love," he said.
Edy targets North Sumatra to be able to win overall championship at three national events at the student level. If that is not achieved, then it will be evaluated to be achieved in the following year. "The target is to dominate. We have to be the overall champion. If we can't get it now, it's as lesson material now. We should be chasing next year. But, this year we have the maximum to do," Edy explained.
The Governor of North Sumatra hopes athletes not to give up under any conditions for the best achievement. "Kelen was dispatched to fight in any condition. There is no reason whatsoever for you not to win. Whatever your condition, we must excel," Edy ordered.
Edy admitted, student athletes are now the forerunners of senior athletes who will compete in national events such as the National Sports Week (PON) 2024, when North Sumatra and Aceh co-host together. Edy also advised all athletes to exert maximum ability for the good name of oneself, family and country.
"Make a big name for yourself, your family, your province and your people. There are no other goals. You have dared to be an athlete. Never give up, if you need to pass out at the finish. North Sumatra is not great, if there are no children who excel. Win "You are asking for talent scouting going forward. You are proud of this North Sumatra 2024 PON here," pleaded the North Sumatra Governor.
While the head of the North Sumatra contingent Baharuddin Siagian said at the three events a total of 280 North Sumatra contingents were athletes, coaches, and officials.
"The number of Peparpenas contingents is 33 people from five sports. Popnas 126 consists of 11 sports. 121 Pospenas contingents from various pesantren throughout North Sumatra," Baharuddin said.
Baharuddin hopes that the departure and motivation provided by the Governor of North Sumatra will increase the morale of students and students before competing. "Hopefully this departure can be a motivation and make North Sumatra dignified in the field of sports," hoped Baharuddin.

20 Peparpenas Athletes

In this year's Peparpenas, the North Sumatra contingent will be strengthened by 20 athletes from five sports which are divided into four types of classification. The blind classifications were chosen by four athletes namely Muhammad Triresha Anjasta, Fransiskus Zebua (athletics), Khairunnnisa and Yayukari Mendrofa (chess). Then 8 Taksa M Auliya Anshori (swimming) athletes, Muhammad Rizky, Prayuda, Desy Manik, Robby Syahrul Ramadhan, Geryn Pratama Simatupang, Reza Aulia (athletics). And Zay Fachri (Boccia). Then tuna Grahita M Khairurrasyid (badminton), Yuwanda, Timothy Cen Agung, Agnes Monica (athletic). And the Deaf Speech of Riyadh Firmansyah, Madinsama Arinta Pinem, and Lidya Meisyarah (athletics), and Janesa Liliana (swimming).
Baharuddin Siagian said that the regional election was conducted openly by recruiting disabled athletes from a number of special and public school foundations in North Sumatra. With this selekda, of course, to get the best athletes, to strengthen North Sumatra in Peparpenas 2019. "Yes, this is one of the series that we do so that recruiting athletes is not happy. We have to look at all aspects, aspects of the athlete's abilities and the techniques he gets. So, it is not just dirty, just dirty, "said the man who is also the Head of the North Sumatra Youth and Sports Office (Kadispora).
Previously, the North Sumatra athletes will begin the match at the IX Peparpenas event, which starts November 6-13, in Jakarta. Then continue at the XV Popnas from November 16-25 in Jakarta. As well as the VIII Pospenas starting November 24-30 in Bandung, West Java.
Also present in the release of athletes members of North Sumatra DPRD Yulizar Pargalutan, Kakanwil Regional Minister of Religion Provsu, Iwan Zulhami, Forkopimdasu, North Sumatra NPC, North Sumatra KONI, and sports organizers. (J)
